message: Especially WRT their respective compilation steps.
Anyone know of any difficulties combining Sproutcore and Coffeescript?

Just set up your editor to compile CoffeeScript on save. coffee-mode for Emacs can do this. Or, better, fork Abbot (their build tool: https://github.com/sproutcore/abbot) and add CoffeeScript support.
Working great for me. I wrote up a couple tips for getting started: erikbryn.com/post/5671454066/using-coffeescript-with-sproutcore
That blog post "using coffeescript with sproutcore" lead to a dead end for me. I believe the sproutcore-coffeescript gem does not work correctly with the newer dev version of SproutCore.

I found a very easy way to get the CoffeeScript working with SproutCore. First install CoffeeScript then run `coffee -wcb **/*.coffee` in your app directory. That command will watch for changes to *.coffee files and automatically compile them to js when they are modified. The only problem is that it does not recognize new *.coffee files and I have to manually restart the coffee watcher process.
